methods.name: owner
methods.desc: @devReturns the address of the current owner.

methods.name: _checkOwner
methods.desc: @devThrows if the sender is not the owner.

methods.name: transferOwnership
methods.desc: @devTransfers ownership of the application to a new account (`newOwner`).Can only be called by the current owner.

methods.name: pendingOwner
methods.desc: @devReturns the address of the pending owner.

methods.name: transferOwnership2S
methods.desc: @devStarts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one.Can only be called by the current owner.FIX: Once overrides exist, rename to transferOwnership

methods.name: acceptOwnership
methods.desc: @devThe new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

methods.name: pauser
methods.desc: @noticeReturns current pauser@returnPauser's address

methods.name: pause
methods.desc: @devcalled by the owner to pause, triggers stopped state

methods.name: unpause
methods.desc: @devcalled by the owner to unpause, returns to normal state

methods.name: updatePauser
methods.desc: @devupdate the pauser role

methods.name: enableAttester
methods.desc: @noticeEnables an attester@devOnly callable by attesterManager. New attester must not be attesters.

args.name: newAttester
args.desc: attester to enable

methods.name: offsetOfEnabledAttester
methods.desc: @noticereturns the index of a given`attester`, else fails

args.name: attester
args.desc: attester to retrieve index of@returnindex of given`attester`, else fails

methods.name: getNumEnabledAttesters
methods.desc: @noticereturns the number of enabled attesters@returnnumber of enabled attesters

methods.name: updateAttesterManager
methods.desc: FIX: onlyOwner or onlyAttesterManager?@devAllows the current attester manager to transfer control of the application to a newAttesterManager.

args.name: newAttesterManager
args.desc: The address to update attester manager to.

methods.name: disableAttester
methods.desc: @noticeDisables an attester@devOnly callable by attesterManager. Disabling the attester is not allowed if there is only one attesterenabled, or if it would cause the number of enabled attesters to become less than signatureThreshold.(Attester must be currently enabled.)

args.name: attester
args.desc: attester to disable

methods.name: setSignatureThreshold
methods.desc: @noticeSets the threshold of signatures required to attest to a message.(This is the m in m/n multisig.)@devnew signature threshold must be nonzero, and must not exceed numberof enabled attesters.

args.name: newSignatureThreshold
args.desc: new signature threshold

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.desc: Send the message to the destination domain and recipient@devIncrement nonce, format the message, and emit`MessageSent`eventwith message information.

args.name: destinationDomain
args.desc: Domain of destination chain

args.name: recipient
args.desc: Address of message recipient on destination chain as bytes32

args.name: messageBody
args.desc: Raw bytes content of message@returnnonce reserved by message

methods.name: replaceMessage
methods.desc: Replace a message with a new message body and/or destination caller.@devThe`originalAttestation`must be a valid attestation of`originalMessage`.Reverts if msg.sender does not match sender of original message, or ifthe source domain of the original message does not match thisMessageTransmitter's local domain.

args.name: originalMessage
args.desc: original message to replace

args.name: originalAttestation
args.desc: attestation of`originalMessage`

args.name: newMessageBody
args.desc: new message body of replaced message

args.name: newDestinationCaller
args.desc: the new destination caller, which may be thesame as the original destination caller, a new destination caller, or an emptydestination caller (bytes32(0), indicating that any destination caller is valid.)

methods.name: sendMessageWithCaller
methods.desc: Send the message to the destination domain and recipient, for aspecified`destinationCaller`on the destination domain.@devIncrement nonce, format the message, and emit`MessageSent`eventwith message information.WARNING: if the`destinationCaller`does not represent a valid address,then it will not be possible to broadcast the message on the destinationdomain. This is an advanced feature, and the standard sendMessage() shouldbe preferred for use cases where a specific destination caller is notrequired.

args.name: destinationDomain
args.desc: Domain of destination chain

args.name: recipient
args.desc: Address of message recipient on destination domain as bytes32

args.name: destinationCaller
args.desc: caller on the destination domain, as bytes32

args.name: messageBody
args.desc: Raw bytes content of message@returnnonce reserved by message

methods.name: receiveMessage
methods.desc: Receive a message. Messages with a given noncecan only be broadcast once for a (sourceDomain, destinationDomain)pair. The message body of a valid message is passed to thespecified recipient for further processing.@devAttestation format:A valid attestation is the concatenated 65-byte signature(s) of exactly`thresholdSignature`signatures, in increasing order of attester address.***If the attester addresses recovered from signatures are not inincreasing order, signature verification will fail.***If incorrect number of signatures or duplicate signatures are supplied,signature verification will fail.Message format:Field                 Bytes      Type       Indexversion               4          uint32     0sourceDomain          4          uint32     4destinationDomain     4          uint32     8nonce                 8          uint64     12sender                32         bytes32    20recipient             32         bytes32    52destinationCaller     32         bytes32    84messageBody           dynamic    bytes      116

args.name: message
args.desc: Message bytes

args.name: attestation
args.desc: Concatenated 65-byte signature(s) of`message`, in increasing orderof the attester address recovered from signatures.@returnsuccess bool, true if successful

events.name: MessageReceived

args.name: caller
args.desc: Caller (this.txn.sender) on destination domain

args.name: sourceDomain
args.desc: The source domain this message originated from

args.name: nonce
args.desc: The nonce unique to this message

args.name: sender
args.desc: The sender of this message

args.name: messageBody
args.desc: message body bytes

events.desc: Emitted when a new message is received

methods.name: setMaxMessageBodySize
methods.desc: Sets the max message body size@devThis value should not be reduced without good reason,to avoid impacting users who rely on large messages.

args.name: newMaxMessageBodySize
args.desc: new max message body size, in bytes

events.name: MaxMessageBodySizeUpdated

args.name: newMaxMessageBodySize
args.desc: new maximum message body size, in bytes

events.desc: Emitted when max message body size is updated

events.name: MessageSent

args.name: message
args.desc: Raw bytes of message

events.desc: Emitted when a new message is dispatched

events.name: MessageReceived

args.name: caller
args.desc: Caller (this.txn.sender) on destination domain

args.name: sourceDomain
args.desc: The source domain this message originated from

args.name: nonce
args.desc: The nonce unique to this message

args.name: sender
args.desc: The sender of this message

args.name: messageBody
args.desc: message body bytes

events.desc: Emitted when a new message is received

events.name: MaxMessageBodySizeUpdated

args.name: newMaxMessageBodySize
args.desc: new maximum message body size, in bytes

events.desc: Emitted when max message body size is updated
